title: Ihor Snurnitsyn
text:
Ihor Serhiyovych Snurnitsyn (; born 7 March 2000) is a <a href="Ukraine">Ukrainian</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> player who plays for <a href="FC%20Zorya%20Luhansk">Zorya Luhansk</a>.
Club career.
He made his <a href="Ukrainian%20Premier%20League">Ukrainian Premier League</a> debut for <a href="FC%20Olimpik%20Donetsk">FC Olimpik Donetsk</a> on 15 April 2018 in a game against <a href="FC%20Oleksandriya">FC Oleksandriya</a>.
International.
He represented Ukraine at the <a href="2017%20UEFA%20European%20Under-17%20Championship">2017 UEFA European Under-17 Championship</a>, Ukraine did not advance from the group stage.
He also appeared in one group-stage game at the <a href="2018%20UEFA%20European%20Under-19%20Championship">2018 UEFA European Under-19 Championship</a> as Ukraine reached the semifinals. On June 15, 2019 Snurnitsyn won the FIFA U-20 World Cup, being in the squad of Ukraine national U-20 team.
